DisplayTest.title: Display Test
DisplayTest.description:
Check for dead pixels and backlight bleeding on your screen.
Test your monitor's contrast and color accuracy.
DisplayTest.instruction: ðŸ’¡ Tests enter fullscreen mode. Click or press Space to cycle through colors.
DisplayTest.whyTestDesc: Whether you've just bought a new monitor, laptop, or smartphone, or you're troubleshooting an old one, verifying your screen's health is crucial. Manufacturing defects like dead pixels or backlight bleeding can affect your viewing experience. Our Display Test tool helps you identify these issues quickly and easily directly from your browser, with no software installation required.
DisplayTest.deadVsStuckDesc: Dead Pixels are pixels that fail to light up, appearing as black dots on a bright background. They are usually permanent hardware faults. Stuck Pixels are pixels frozen in a specific color (Red, Green, or Blue). Unlike dead pixels, stuck pixels can sometimes be fixed by rapidly flashing colors over the area, which forces the liquid crystal to reset.
DisplayTest.backlightDesc: Backlight bleeding occurs when light from the monitor's backlight leaks around the edges of the screen. It is most visible when viewing dark scenes in a dimly lit room. Use our Black Screen Test (the first color in the cycle) to check for uneven brightness along the bezels of your display.
DisplayTest.howToDeadPixel: Dead Pixel Test: Cycles through solid primary colors (Red, Green, Blue, White, Black). Look for any tiny dots that don't match the background color.
DisplayTest.howToContrast: Contrast Test: Displays a grayscale gradient. A good monitor should allow you to distinguish between each step of the gradient, especially the darkest and lightest ends.
DisplayTest.howToFullscreen: Fullscreen Mode: For the most accurate results, the tests automatically enter fullscreen mode to remove browser distractions.
DisplayTest.clickToContinue: Click or press Space to continue â€¢ ESC to exit
DisplayTest.clickToExit: Click or press ESC to exit

DisplayTest.title: Free Online Display Test - Check Dead Pixels | DailyKit
DisplayTest.description: Easily check your monitor for dead pixels, backlight bleeding, and screen uniformity with our free online test tool.

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.intro: At DailyKit, accessible from dailykit.com, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by DailyKit and how we use it.
Privacy.logFilesDesc: DailyKit follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services' analytics.
Privacy.cookiesDesc: Like any other website, DailyKit uses 'cookies'. These cookies are used to store information including visitors' preferences, and the pages on the website that the visitor accessed or visited.
Privacy.googleDesc: Google is one of a third-party vendor on our site. It also uses cookies, known as DART cookies, to serve ads to our site visitors based upon their visit to www.website.com and other sites on the internet.
